results.title: Textile technician
results.creator_credit: Mutual Film Corporation and Career Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Is this your career series”
Complex machinery is necessary at the various levels of textile manufacture. Follows the raw cotton through the spinning mill as it is processed into yarn. Then to the knitting mill, where yarn is woven into knitted garments. In the weaving mill, entirely different processes are carried out by different machines. Throughout the film, textile technicians are seen servicing this specialised machinery, some of which can tie the ends of broken yarn together again.

results.title: Ten times empty
results.creator_credit: I Wilson, J Tristram and Juniper Films
results.brief_description: A study of life in a Greek village community on the island of Simi, a barren rocky island lying in the Aegean Sea off the coast of Turkey, with particular emphasis on the surrendering of traditional means of livelihood because of changing economic circumstances. Migration is a central theme of the film, with special reference to Australia. Scenes of the island reveal that despite a lack of factories, farming and jobs, close cultural and community ties bind the 3,000 inhabitants together.

results.title: Sunday in Melbourne
results.creator_credit: Paul Olson, Gil Brealey, State Film Centre of Victoria and Melbourne Repertory Film Unit
results.brief_description: An experiment in the creative use of colour visuals, natural sound and dialogue commentary, this film shows the loneliness of the aimless wanderers in the city streets contrasted with those who have companionship on their Sunday. (Award: Special Award for an Experimental Film in the Australian Film Awards, Melbourne Film Festival, 1958) Rights held by Gil Brealey.

results.title: Struggle
results.creator_credit: Peter Baroutis, Dale Butler, Keith Morris and Eureka Films
results.brief_description: In an effort to salvage some land for recreational and park use in 1971, the residents of North Carlton, an inner suburb of Melbourne, came into opposition with the building contractor representing Kimberley-Clark Australia Pty Ltd. The company had proposed plans for building a warehouse for Kleenex products on the site. Unions joined forces with the residents against the building contractor, and the film shows some of those involved voicing their opinions and how events developed during the conflict. The confrontation leads to speeches, shouting, strong language, demonstrations and some violence and the increasing involvement of progressive Trade Unions in matters other than the bread-and-butter struggle. Suitable for secondary school level.

results.title: The Simpson automa-boot
results.brief_description: This film is an amusing animated cartoon made by Form I students from Moorabbin Technical College. It follows the activities of an “automatic boot” which takes the user wherever they may wish to go in a fantasy world. The producer’s aim was to give the students an opportunity for creative work in which cooperation between students, descriptive writing, animation of the human form and self-disclipine would be required. Animation by Colin Jenkins and Andrew Mougemore. Painters - Neil Stevenson, Tony McFarland, Steven Witcraft, Dave Harmo, Emily McPherson, Trevor Williams.

results.title: Sidney Nolan
results.brief_description: Sidney Nolan’s interest in and pre-occupation with Australian history and legend have earned him the affectionate title “The Songman of his tribe”. Nolan’s imaginative and poetic vision is revealed in some 150 paintings. His earliest works and his series on Ned Kelly, Mrs Frazer, Bourke and Wills, the Australian outback, Eureka Stockade, Leda and the swan, and Gallipoli, give a rare insight into the mind and stature of this artist. Also shows the artist at work in his studio.

results.title: Showtime
results.creator_credit: Anne Bourke and State Film Centre of Victoria
results.brief_description:
A film of the Royal Melbourne Show as seen through the eyes of a family group. Grandfather, a retired farmer, takes his daughter and her two teenage children to the show. To people like breeders of livestock, farmers and agricultural equipment salesmen, the show is an important yearly event, but for the family there is something to interest each member. Cooking demonstrations, displays of horsemanship, and the extensive pavilions showing domestic pets as well as farm animals all have their appeal.

Selected highlights list:
00:00:14:00 animated graphics title ‘Showtime’, ‘produced by State Film Centre Victoria Westrex Sound’
00:00:30:00 a 1950s model crane truck
00:00:45:00 a 1950s model electricians van with lettering for ‘RHC Sound System’
00:00:57:00 scenes of preparing for the Show - cleaning, painting tyres and signs, brushing cattle
00:01:26:00 first look at animals on show in the main arena
00:02:16:00 draft horses
00:02:26:00 goats
00:02:35:00 and showing off the fleece on a large ram and holding a large rooster up to the camera
00:02:50:00 the Berkshire pigs at the Show
00:03:02:00 a ‘red rattler’ style Show Special train pulls into the platform and people disembark, including the narrator and his family who quickly start looking at exhibits at the Show
00:03:53:00 first showbag pavilion
00:04:05:00 signs for popular soft drink at the time. Tarax
00:04:30:00 the Guernsey cattle pavilion
00:05:06:00 bundles of wheat and Government information about wheat on display
00:05:29:00 baby hen chicks
00:05:55:00 large flock of sheep
00:06:05:00 Centenary Hall at the Melbourne Showgrounds followed by exhibitions of shearing sheep with hand shears and then with electric shears
00:06:35:00 a fashion parade at the Show followed by doll making and hand knits craft exhibition
00:07:27:00 looking at exhibitions of food preservation, tiered wedding cakes, and cooking class on laminations
00:07:45:00 whitegoods exhibition beginning with a well stocked drinks cabinet with built in fridge and semi-automatic washing machine in action
00:07:59:00 an exhibition set up as a butchers shop shows sausage making
00:08:15:00 the wood-chopping exhibition and competition at the Show followed by exhibition of different types of chainsaws
00:09:00:00 the diary pavilion
00:09:17:00 inspecting the brand new, shining Massey-Ferguson tractors tried out by very keen young man of the family
00:09:44:00 new motor cars on show including a promotion for the new Ford Zephyr
00:09:55:00 carnival rides including the ‘Noddy Car Ride’ (character featured in Enid Blyton books)
00:10:30:00 aerial view of the Showgrounds
00:10:46:00 sideshow tents
00:11:47:00 fairy floss tent
00:11:55:00 cut flowers pavilion
00:12:16:00 dog show
00:13:30:00 the Australian Mint exhibition followed by several show bag stalls
00:14:15:00 crowds at the main arena followed by horse jumping, harness racing and other competitions, including what might be sheaf sack tossing
00:15:09:00 the Grand Parade in the main arena at the Show which includes many of the exhibitors, winners and placegetters
00:17:07:00 fireworks and title ‘The End’
results.creator_credit_for_label: Anne Bourke and State Film Centre of Victoria
results.description:
A film of the Royal Melbourne Show as seen through the eyes of a family group. Grandfather, a retired farmer, takes his daughter and her two teenage children to the show. To people like breeders of livestock, farmers and agricultural equipment salesmen, the show is an important yearly event, but for the family there is something to interest each member. Cooking demonstrations, displays of horsemanship, and the extensive pavilions showing domestic pets as well as farm animals all have their appeal.

Selected highlights list:
00:00:14:00 animated graphics title ‘Showtime’, ‘produced by State Film Centre Victoria Westrex Sound’
00:00:30:00 a 1950s model crane truck
00:00:45:00 a 1950s model electricians van with lettering for ‘RHC Sound System’
00:00:57:00 scenes of preparing for the Show - cleaning, painting tyres and signs, brushing cattle
00:01:26:00 first look at animals on show in the main arena
00:02:16:00 draft horses
00:02:26:00 goats
00:02:35:00 and showing off the fleece on a large ram and holding a large rooster up to the camera
00:02:50:00 the Berkshire pigs at the Show
00:03:02:00 a ‘red rattler’ style Show Special train pulls into the platform and people disembark, including the narrator and his family who quickly start looking at exhibits at the Show
00:03:53:00 first showbag pavilion
00:04:05:00 signs for popular soft drink at the time. Tarax
00:04:30:00 the Guernsey cattle pavilion
00:05:06:00 bundles of wheat and Government information about wheat on display
00:05:29:00 baby hen chicks
00:05:55:00 large flock of sheep
00:06:05:00 Centenary Hall at the Melbourne Showgrounds followed by exhibitions of shearing sheep with hand shears and then with electric shears
00:06:35:00 a fashion parade at the Show followed by doll making and hand knits craft exhibition
00:07:27:00 looking at exhibitions of food preservation, tiered wedding cakes, and cooking class on laminations
00:07:45:00 whitegoods exhibition beginning with a well stocked drinks cabinet with built in fridge and semi-automatic washing machine in action
00:07:59:00 an exhibition set up as a butchers shop shows sausage making
00:08:15:00 the wood-chopping exhibition and competition at the Show followed by exhibition of different types of chainsaws
00:09:00:00 the diary pavilion
00:09:17:00 inspecting the brand new, shining Massey-Ferguson tractors tried out by very keen young man of the family
00:09:44:00 new motor cars on show including a promotion for the new Ford Zephyr
00:09:55:00 carnival rides including the ‘Noddy Car Ride’ (character featured in Enid Blyton books)
00:10:30:00 aerial view of the Showgrounds

00:11:47:00 fairy floss tent
00:11:55:00 cut flowers pavilion
00:12:16:00 dog show
00:13:30:00 the Australian Mint exhibition followed by several show bag stalls
00:14:15:00 crowds at the main arena followed by horse jumping, harness racing and other competitions, including what might be sheaf sack tossing
00:15:09:00 the Grand Parade in the main arena at the Show which includes many of the exhibitors, winners and placegetters
00:17:07:00 fireworks and title ‘The End’
description_for_label:
A film of the Royal Melbourne Show as seen through the eyes of a family group. Grandfather, a retired farmer, takes his daughter and her two teenage children to the show. To people like breeders of livestock, farmers and agricultural equipment salesmen, the show is an important yearly event, but for the family there is something to interest each member. Cooking demonstrations, displays of horsemanship, and the extensive pavilions showing domestic pets as well as farm animals all have their appeal.
